means: （用作单数）戏剧表演，舞台艺术

sentence.Network_en: When I explained every-thing to my mum and dad, there were no histrionics.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一五一十地把一切都向父母解释清楚了。

sentence.Network_en: Somehow all this anguish and excitement, all the grief and histrionics, only whetted my appetite.
sentence.Network_cn: 不知怎么搞的,她所有这些痛苦和激动 、 所有的悲伤和做作只是激发了我的欲望.

entry.def: If you disapprove of someone's dramatic and exaggerated behaviour, you can describe it as histrionics .

example.ex: When I explained everything to my mum and dad, there were no histrionics.
example.tran: 我一五一十地把一切都向父母解释清楚了。

means.word_mean: 2. a deliberate display of emotion for effect
